results.title: Types of chemical change
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Introducing Chemistry”
Introduces four basic types of chemical reactions: direct combination, decomposition, simple displacement and double displacement.

results.title: Ty's homemade band
results.creator_credit: Gary Templeton, Evergreen Productions and Phoenix Film
results.brief_description: A stranger appears in town and helps a group of young children form their own homemade band, with the instruments made out of domestic utensils, and the children put on a concert for the neighbourhood. Ty’s one man band by Mildred Pitts Walter.

results.title: Two/out [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Kriv Stenders, Catherine Kerr and Pod Films
results.brief_description:
Jack and Tom are cellmates with a tenuous friendship. Their fragile bond begins to unravel when Jack develops dementia, and Tom, unable to understand Jack’s condition forces them into a physical confrontation which challenges the nature of their relationship.
Utilising only one shot and a series of dissolves and jump cuts, this powerful short film examines the relationship between two men who share a single gaol cell. When the subject of the lack of the female object emerges, the tiny space they inhabit erupts into violence and frustrated desire.

results.title: Two wheeler
results.creator_credit: Bill Snyder, Len Aitken and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: This film provides a penetrating view inside the world of bicycle racing. The colour and excitement of the sport are experienced as the camera follows a race from the exhilarating start to the pressure and frustration of the finish. Dramatic camera angles and comments by the racers involve the audience in strategy and techniques. There is appealing action for the non-bicycler as well as the seasoned racer.

results.title: Two weeks in Japan
results.brief_description: Travelogue showing various parts of Japan with its lovely landscapes, mountains and seas, teeming modern cities and quiet country villages, and its many unique festivals.

results.title: Two views on socialism
results.brief_description: Specially designed to stimulate an intellectual discussion on the difference between socialism and capitalism. The basic charges levelled by socialists against capitalistic society are made and answered.

results.title: Two trumpets for St Andrew
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Australian Broadcasting Commission and Intertel
results.brief_description: Through the rivalry of two trumpeters representing brass bands of St Andrew’s Club and the Union Club, in Luga, Southern Malta, we are shown a picture of Maltese life, changing from its age-old religious conformities to meet with the demands of the 20th century, which is rapidly encroaching on its social and cultural customs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Australian Broadcasting Commission and Intertel

results.title: Two pots, a caffe latte, a scotch and dry, a vodka lime and lemon, and a small antipasto with 5 forks
results.creator_credit: Matt Saville, Peter Tammer and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Waitress Elaine finds herself face to face with ex boyfriend, Rory, when he turns up to her yuppie watering hole for a drink. On her break she describes the decline of the relationship to her co-worker, and before the shift is over she is able to wreak revenge thanks to a stolen mobile phone and a cleverly procured visa card. Cast includes Caroline Bock, David Cotter and Elena Mendalis.

results.title: Two out of five
results.creator_credit: Francine Vande Wiele, Jean Calvell and Unesco
results.brief_description: Two out of five of the world’s population cannot read or write, and the campaign to promote literacy is of great importance for economic and social development. Scenes in African and Asian countries illustrate the great efforts being made in many underdeveloped areas.

results.title: Two mountain lands: Andes and Alps
results.creator_credit: Andrew B. Nemes, Audio Visual Productions and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Contrasts the life of a Swiss Alpine dairy farmer with that of a terrace farmer from the Peruvian Andes. Shows differences in farming methods, transportation systems, traditions and economic structures. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
